document_title: Lupus glomerulonephritis: Causes, symptoms and treatment
subsection_content:
For every 10,000 people in the world, 3 people suffer from this disease. Lupus nephritis is more common in women than men, between the ages of 20 and 40. (2)
The main cause of lupus nephritis is systemic lupus erythematosus. In addition, a number of factors can increase the risk of disease, including: genetics, gender, environmental factors such as tobacco, shingles virus, stress...
